title: Project Engineer
tagsAndSkills: MS Excel,Marine,Air Compressor,Shipping,Diesel Engines,Boiler,Maritime,reporting of Plant maintenance system

ambitionBoxData.Title: JiBe Development Services Reviews by Employees

jobDescription:
The Project Engineer will be working as part of the JiBe PMS data building team responsible to screen the PMS data, extract the relevant jobs and job details in order prepare the equipment and PMS job structure for the vessels being built by the team.


The Project Engineer shall be required to perform below jobs

  • Screen and extract job, job descriptions and the relevant job details from maker manuals, ISM, SMS, CMS yard supplied manuals, or any other source provided by the client
  • Map the extracted job titles to the JiBe Jobs Blueprint
  • Draft the job descriptions in a clear, structured and technically accurate manner
  • Identify and record the job attachments required to be extracted from the provided manuals in order to be attached as part of the job procedures
  • Extract machinery particulars out of the maker/ yard manuals
  • Prepare the Equipment Structure/hierarchy
  • Prepare Machinery-locations/Components-sets installed as provided in makers manuals or vessel plans
  • Merging and processing the various data sources into one coherent PMS file. Data sources can include Class instructions, Manuals and various procedures agreed with Client (SMS jobs, Alarm jobs)
  • Monitor and guide teammates to achieve their target on time and data with high accuracy and quality
  • Planning, assigning and reporting all tasks on the task management system
  • Ensure tasks and projects are completed as per the required schedule
  • Machine Learning and AI data building experience

Qualifications and Skill

  • Background in Marine engineering/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent engineering degree
  • Sailing background as (TME, 4th Engineer) is preferred
  • Fluency in written and spoken English
  • Excellent typing skills
  • Self-motivated, independent and meticulous with an eye for detail
  • Team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
  • PMS knowledge or relevant experience will be considered as an advantage
  • ERP / PMS software experience will be considered as an advantage
  • Marine industry data building experience will be considered as an advantage
  • Experience in supply chain management related to the shipping industry will be considered as an advantage.

title: Hiring For ADL Department (GLP) Navi Mumbai
tagsAndSkills: GLP,Calibration,Stability Analysis,OOS,OOT,Csv,GMP,Instrument Calibration
jobDescription:
Company Name - Harman Finochem Limited

Experience required - 1 to 4 yrs.

Qualification - M.sc Chemistry

Location - Turbhe, Navi Mumbai


Role & responsibilities -

  • Should have thorough knowledge of qualification of instruments and equipments used in laboratory.
  • Must be able to calibrate instruments and equipment, such as FTIR, Polarimeter, analytical balances, UV-VIS spectrophotometers, GCs, and HPLCs.
  • Should be able to prepare and review SOPs, calibration and qualification records.
  • Should have knowledge of CSV (computer system validation) and GAMP categorization for laboratory softwares.
  • Should have knowledge of the life-cycle management of instruments and equipment.
  • Should have thorough knowledge and understanding of GMP/GLP requirements as these pertain to work performed in the laboratory.
  • Should have knowledge of OMCL, ICH guidelines and other related guidances.

Preferred candidate profile

Candidate Should have good knowledge in GLP

Should also have experience in CSV and Calibration of instruments.


Interested candidates can share resume on hrnavimumbai@harmanfinochem.com

title: Credit Risk Modeler
tagsAndSkills: SAS,Credit Risk,PD,Lgd,Ead,PDS,Modeling,Risk Modeling
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities


The IFRS9 Provisions Modelling Team is responsible for the development and implementation of credit models used for IFRS9 expected credit loss (ECL) estimation. The team is responsible for taking credit models through the full end-to-end process of model development: from scoping models to model development, model governance, model implementation, and model maintenance according to the bank's risk framework.



Responsibilities

  • Responsible for hands-on development, maintenance, and implementation of PD, LGD, and EAD for IFRS9 purposes. Minimum 3+ years of hands-on IFRS9/Credit model development experience in both retail and commercial banking.
  • Core responsibility is focused on leading/supporting Model developments (PD, LGD, and EAD) including the development of models as an end-to-end process: Scope model requirements, data reviews, portfolio analysis, model developments, engaging with key stakeholders, creating model documentation, taking models through internal governance process for approval, and supporting the implementation of models.
  • Expected to proactively contribute to the model development strategy and modelling methodologies to improve IFRS9 expected credit loss models.

  • Engage with the internal validation team and external auditors, as part of the model validation and review process.

  • Other responsibilities also include producing annual reviews of models, reviewing the model performance, model calibration, model back testing, creating supporting analysis on models, and supporting model implementation within the bank's credit risk framework.


Qualification

  • Minimum Qualification - B Degree in Maths, Stats, Engineering, Computer Science, Econometrics, Physics or Actuarial Science
  • Preferred Qualification Honors/Masters Degree

Experience

3+ years' experience in a data environment, of which 1 - 2 years ideally at a junior (entry-level) management level. Strong technical, commercial, and practical understanding of PD, LGD, and EAD Models and how these models are used for provisioning and capital estimation purposes. Strong Analytical Skills: Quantitative Problem Solving and Judgements. Ability to analyze interpret and present complex analytical data, both verbally and in writing. Strong experience in developing practical technical solutions with limited data.


Note: SAS experience is Mandatory.







Preferred candidate profile



Perks and benefits
